Sections.Value:
- Purchase certified crop seed and animal feed to reduce the chance of contamination
- As seeds can travel on animals and machinery, do not allow animals into an affected area, limit machinery use in the area and keep machinery clean to prevent spread
- Keep crop healthy to maximize competitiveness - use optimal water and fertilizer levels
- Grow plants that will outcompete the weed, such as Cassia spp. (e.g. C. tora, C. uniflora, C. occidentalis) and Tagetes spp. (e.g. T. erecta)
- Organic mulch, such as rice straw mulch, and inorganic mulch, such as woven polypropylene groundcovers, can generally help control weeds
- For pasture, encourage good grass coverage since grass can outcompete the weed. Limit the amount of grazing in a particular area:
• Supply multiple watering points to prevent livestock congregating
• Rotate livestock between paddocks
• Fence-off areas becoming overgrazed

- Fast-maturing annual (sometimes perennial) herb, top half very brached when mature, 1-2.5 m tall
- Leaves: pale green, deeply lobed, hairy, up to 2 mm long
- Seeds: black, two thin white scales, 2 mm long
- Flower heads: small, creamy-white, slightly hairy, grow on stem tips, 4-10 mm; consist of multiple florets (small flowers); five-pointed
- Soon after germination, it forms a rosette of pale green, young, strongly divided leaves, 8-20 cm in length, 4-8 cm in width
- As it matures, the stem elongates and becomes woody. Leaves are smaller, narrower and less dissected
- Can be confused with ragweeds (Ambrosia spp.) which have small, greenish flower heads and upright stems that are branched at the base and grow in large clumps

- Do not hand-pull. If handling the weed wear gloves and long-sleeved clothes since parthenium is toxic
- A combination of methods will be required to control the weed. Carry these out before the weed flowers or sets seed to prevent spread:
• Plough the land at least 5 cm deep to inhibit seed survival
• Cut the weed at ground level - this is only a temporary measure. The weed will grow back unless the roots are removed
• Burn the weeds when plants are dry (if permitted in your country)
• Once the weed is cleared, encourage growth of competative plants (see prevention) to keep the parthenium population low
• Use established biocontrol agents if available in your country, such as Zygogramma bicolorata, Piblema strenuana, Listronotus setosipennis, and Smicronyx lutulentus. Some rust species, such as Puccinia abrupta, also damage the weed
- Control measures may need to be repeated over a long period since seed can stay in the soil seed bank for years

Pesticides may be available to control this pest. Please check with the Ministry of Agriculture in your country to find out which pesticides are registered in your country and the local restrictions for their use.

Sections.Value:
- Purchase and sow certified crop and pasture seed to reduce the chance of contamination
- Seeds are spread by animals - do not allow livestock into an affected area to avoid spread
- Seeds travel on machinery - clean equipment and vehicules after work in infested areas
- Prevent spread of Sida by slashing or mowing before it flowers
- Avoid overgrazing to prevent establishment of the weed in disturbed patches

- Small shrub (0.5-1.5m) with lanceolate leaves with dented egde.
- The flowers are yellow, solitary, 1-2 cm in diameter and on a short stalk 0.3-0.8 cm long. Each flower has six petals and produces seeds with two awns, thus attaching easily to animal fur
- The fruit is a hard, brown capsule, 3-5 mm in diameter, breaking into 5-8 triangular segments
- Regularly check waste and other ruderal sites, because these are usually the first invaded by Sida
- Check for flowering and seed development to prevent seed set, spread and build up of seed bank

- Dig up single plants prior to onset of flowering, ensuring the taproot is severed well below the crown to prevent regrowth
- Plow or hand-weed after the first rains have induced germination, followed by sowing of dense pasture or cover crop
- Larger areas can be controlled by repeated cultivation until the soil seed bank is depleted
- Competitive grasses may be effective in suppressing Sida, when combined with other control measures

Pesticides may be available to control this pest. Please check with the Ministry of Agriculture in your country to find out which pesticides are registered in your country and the local restrictions for their use.

Sections.Value:
- Clean material, boots, clothing and vehicles when moving out of infested areas
- Seeds are spread by animals - do not allow livestock into an affected area to avoid spread
- Species is spread by water - use only water from sources free of the weed and avoid runoff from surrounding infested fields
- The species is spread by wind - limit seed set in surrounding populations
- Mulching using plastic sheeting or wood shavings reduces establishment from seed

- Annual or perennial herbaceous broadleaved shrub, woody at the base [2–3 (–5) m high]
- Leaves greyish-green, finely hairy on underside giving a grey appearance. Simple, 3–5 (–7) pointed lobes (6–33 cm long and 5–22cm wide)
- Flowers bright yellow, daisy or sunflower-like (up to 10 cm across), carried on long and swollen stalks (7–30 cm long)
- Regularly check fields for presence of the weed and consider direct control when present
- Check for flowering and seed development to prevent seed set, spread and build up of seed bank

- During the rainy season, regularly cut the weeds before flowering. Either chop plants into pieces and heap them within the hedge to dry and decompose of feed to livestock
- Hand-pull and destroy the weeds emerging in the crop field, ensuring the taproot is severed well below the crown to prevent regrowth. Allow them to dry and decompose or feed them to livestock
- Do not slash the plants, as plants can regrow from cut fragments
- Consistent follow-up work is required for sustainable management

Pesticides may be available to control this pest. Please check with the Ministry of Agriculture in your country to find out which pesticides are registered in your country and the local restrictions for their use.

Sections.Value:
- As seeds can travel on animals and machinery, do not allow animals into an affected area, limit machinery use in the area and keep machinery clean to prevent spread
- In pasture, encourage the health and abundance of desirable plant species to make the ecosystem more resilient against invasion

- Upright, branching, annual herb; shallow rooted; up to 1.5 m tall
- Stems: become woody with age; young parts have short white hairs
- Leaves: Egg-shaped, toothed, sparsly hairy, rough, 2-10 cm long, 0.5-5 cm wide
- Flowers: Purple, blue, pinkish or white; less than 0.6 cm across; clusters of flower heads at top of stems; few hairs on bracts surrounding flower heads; projections (styles) of 0.5 cm (gives fluffly appearance); flower head base 0.5-0.8 mm across
- Seeds: Germinate in response to light; viable for 12 months.
- Similar to Ageratum houstonianum which has: numerous sticky hairs on bracts surrounding flower heads; shorter flower projections (styles) of 0.1-0.2 cm; smaller flower head base (0.3-0.6 cm)
- Look along waterways. Seeds are mainly spread via wind, water, on the hair of animals and attached to clothes and agricultural machinery
- Take action as soon as weeds are identified

- Short periods of flooding (water stagnation), for at least 10 days, can reduce weed density and mass
- Use minimum tillage systems such as strip tillage as this reduces weed density
- Can be easily uprooted mechanically as roots are shallow. Do this before weed flowers
- Increase fallow length in slash-and-burn rice production systems to reduce weed mass
- Spread infested ground with thick mulch and leave undisturbed in order to smother the weed

Sections.Value:
- Purchase and sow certified crop and pasture seed to reduce the chance of contamination
- Seeds are spread by animals - do not allow livestock into an affected area to avoid spread
- Seeds are spread on clothes and shoes - remove seeds when leaving an infested area
- Species is spread by water - use only water from sources free of the weed and avoid runoff from surrounding infested fields
- Avoid overgrazing to prevent establishment of the weed in disturbed patches
- Prevent spread of the weed by slashing or mowing wfhen they are still small
- A maize-bean intercropping system can effectively suppress the weed
- Use thick mulch with dry non-weedy plant materials to prevent germination of the weed

- Annual erect broadleaved weed (up to 1 m high) with green composed leaves and a strong taproot
- White flowers with yellow centre and 1 cm long black seeds with 2-4 yellowish awns at one end
- Check fields and surroundings for presence of weed once a week during early crop establishment, and once a month later
- Check for flowering and seed development to prevent seed set, spread and build up of seed bank

- Dig up or hand pull plants prior to onset of flowering, ensuring the taproot is severed well below the crown to prevent regrowth
- Mow or slash the species prior to flowering and seed set
- A no-seed threshold is important as it prevents further spread of the weed

Pesticides may be available to control this pest. Please check with the Ministry of Agriculture in your country to find out which pesticides are registered in your country and the local restrictions for their use.

Authors.Surname: Jonathan M. Gekone (MOALF), Stephen Koech and Miriam Otipa (KALRO)

Sections.Value:
- Panda aina ya mimea sugu kama vile GLP1004 ("Mwezi Moja")
- Panda mimea mapema,wakati viwango vya wadudu bado viko chini, katika shamba lenye halina magugu.
- Wakati unapopalilia, rundika mchanga shinani mwa mimea ili kuifanya itoe mizizi inayotambaa, hii huisaidia kustahimili uharibifu.
- Tumia mbegu zilizothibitishwa kutoka kwa wauzaji waliosajiliwa.
- Zuia upandilianaji wa maharage katika msimu ili kupunguza kujazana.

- Chunguza matawi na shina za mimea ukitafuta ishara za wadudu maramoja baada ya mbegu kuota. Tafuta:
- Nzi wadogo weusi na wenye mbawa tanzuka, na pia alama za walipotaga mayai.
- Shina lililovimba na kupasuka kwenye sehemu ya chini.
- Uwepo wa viwavi na pupa kwenye shina lililovimba na kupasuka.
- Chukua hatua wakati asilimia tano ya mimea imeathirika.

- Ng'oa na uchome mimea yote iliyoathirika.
- Nyunyizia dawa za muarubaini (Azadirachtin) kama Achook, kwa kiwango cha mililita ishirini kwa lita ishirini za maji.

- Tumia nguo maalum za kujikinga wakati unapotumia viuwa wadudu.
- Fuata maagizo yaliyokwenye pakiti au chupa ya viuwa wadudu, halafu tupa mikebe au pakiti zilizotumika mahali panapofaa.
- Kila mara fuatilia ushauri wa orodha ya hivi karibuni ya viuwa wadudu vilivyosajiliwa (PCPB)

- Nyunyizia viuwa wadudu vyenye dawa aina ya 'Imidacloprid', kwa mfano Imaxi 200SC au Confidor200SL, kwa kiwango cha mililita kumi kwa lita ishirini za maji. Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani:(Ina hatari wastani au kiasi), na PHI siku tatu.
- Nyunyizia viuwa wadudu vyenye dawa aina ya 'Thiamethoxam', kwa mfano Actara 25WG, tumia kiwango cha gramu themanini kwa kila lita ishirini za maji. Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani (Ina hatari kidogo), na PHI siku saba.

Factsheets.Title: Beanfly (Bean stem maggot) in Common Bean

Authors.Surname: Nancy Murage (MoALF), Dora Kilalo Dr. (Nairobi University), Alfayo Ombuya (KEPHIS), Willis Ochilo (CABI), Esther macharia  (KALRO), Boniface N. Ndung’u (MoALF)  Miriam Otipa(KALRO)

Sections.Value:
- Panda aina ya miharagwe sugu kama vile Mwezi moja.
- Panda mimea wakati mvua inapoanza (Nzi wa maharage huwa wachache mwanzo wa msimu wa upanzi, na huongezeka baadae).
- Weka mabaki ya mimea ya mchele na nyasi zilizokauka shinani mwa mimea ilikuihifadhi na joto. Rundika mchanga shinani mwa mimea ili kuifanya itoe mizizi inayotambaa, hii huisaidia kustahimili uharibifu.
- Toa mimea yeyote isiyo maharage, ilikuzuia kukua kwa mabuu ya maharage.
- Usipande mimea miingine pamoja na maharage katika shamba lako wakati wa mvua.(Panda aina ya mmea mmoja katika kila msimu wa mvua)
- Loweka au changanya mbegu na viuwa wadudu kabla ya kuzipanda. (Soma maelezo katika 'Udhibiti wa moja kwa moja')
- Usipande maharage karibu na aina nyingine za mikunde kama vile kunde na soya ambazo hupendwa na mabuu ya nzi wa maharage.
- Weka shamba lako likiwa na hali ya usafi wa juu kwa kutupa mabaki ya mimea yeyote.

- Wiki mbili hadi tatu baada ya mbegu kuota, chunguza matawi na shina za mimea ukitafuta ishara za mabuu wa maharage.
- Tafuta:
• Shina lililovimba na kupasuka kwenye sehemu ya chini
• Alama za mayai yaliyotagwa
• Viwavi na pupa shinani karibu na mizizi
- Weka hatua muafaka za kudhibiti mabuu ya nzi wa maharage, wakati mimea asilimia tano hadi kumi inapoathirika.

- Tumia viuwa wadudu vitokavyo kwa mimea kama vile muarubaini: Loweka gramu mia moja ya matawi yaliyokauka kwenye lita moja ya maji moto (centigredi thelathini) na uyahifadhi kwa masaa kumi na mawili; halafu yachunge na unyunyizie mimea.
- Ng'oa na uchome mimea yote iliyoathirika.

- Zingatia kuwa viwavi hukaa ndani ya shina za mimea na hawafikiwi kwa urahisi na viuwa wadudu vinavyonyunyiziwa. Ununuzi wa mbegu zilizopigwa dawa zinazoingia ndani ya mbegu zinapoota, unaweza kusaidia kulinda mimea hiyo dhidi ya nzi wa maharage. Usitumie mbegu zilizopigwa dawa kama chakula ca binadamu au mifugo.
- Tumia nguo maalum za kujikinga, wakati unapotumia viuwa wadudu au dawa au kemikali zozote.
- Fuata maagizo yaliyokwenye pakiti au chupa ya viuwa wadudu, kwa mfano kiwango cha kutumia, mda kabla ya kuvuna na wakati muafaka wa kutumia dawa hiyo.
- Kila mara fuatilia ushauri wa orodha ya hivi karibuni ya viuwa wadudu vilivyosajiliwa (PCPB)

- Tumia dawa zilizo na Diazinon (kama vile Diazol EC, Domain n.k.) kwa kiwango cha mililita arubaini kwa lita ishirini za maji. Njia inavyofanyakazi: 'Organophosphate'. Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani: (Ina hatari wastani au kiasi), PHI siku kumi na nne.
- Tumia dawa zilizo na Acephate (kama vile ACE, WSP, ASATAF n.k.) kwa kiwango cha mililita kumi kwa lita ishirini za maji. Njia inavyofanyakazi: 'Organophosphate'. Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani:(Ina hatari wastani au kiasi), PHI siku saba.
- Tumia dawa zilizo na Imidacloprid (kama vile Confidor 200SL, Imaxi 200SC, TATA MIDA 200SL n.k.) kwa kiwango cha mililita kumi kwa lita ishirini za maji. Tumia kwa njia ya kuloweka ama kufukiza mbegu kabla ya kupanda. Njia inavyofanyakazi: 'Neonicotinoid'. Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani: (Ina hatari wastani au kiasi), PHI siku tatu.

Authors.Surname: Paul Kiige (MOALF), Eunice Ringera (KEPHIS), Philip Wendot  (UON), Benson Masinde (MOALF), Miriam Otipa (KALRO)

Sections.Value:
- Weka mipangilio ya kupanda mimea kama vile vitunguu, mahindi na maharage angalau kwa msimu mmoja.
- Toa mabaki ya mimea yoyote ikiwemo magugu angalau wiki nne kabla ya kupanda kabeji, ili kupunguza idadi ya nondo hawa aina ya 'Diamondback'.
- Weka vitangu vya kabeji mbali na mashamba mengine.
- Pandikiza miche yenye afya, ambayo haina mayai, viwavi au pupa wa nondo aina ya Diamondback au wadudu wengine.
- Tumia neti za kuzuia wadudu, wakati unapopanda miche ndani ya 'greenhouse'.
- Panda nyanya au pilipili ndani ya shamba lako la kabeji.

- Chunguza mimea ukitafuta viwavi vyenye rangi ya mchanganyiko ya manjano na kijani au kijani pekee, vilivyo na umbo la sigara.
- Chunguza nondo aina ya Diamondback wanaofika mapema, na pia tafuta ishara za uharibifu wa viwavu kwenye miche.
- Tumia mitego yenye kutoa harufu wanayopenda hawa nondo waliopevuka aina ya Diamondback ili kuwanasa.
- Chunguza sehemu za matawi zilizotafunwa au zenye mashimo.
- Tafuta viwavi vya nondo aina ya Diamond back kwa kuwa wakati unapowasumbua, wao huvinginyika kwa haraka mbele na nyuma.

- Tumia mtindo wa kunyinyizia mimea maji kutoka juu, hii huwakwamua wadudu hawa kutoka kwenye mimea.
- Panda mimea ambayo hutumika kama mitego, kwa mfano haradali na rapa, katika ukingo wa shamba ili kupunguza uvamizi wa nondo aina ya Diamond back.
- Ukiona idadi ya viwavi ni kidogo unaweza kuwa vyogavyoga kwa kutumia kifaa chochote.
- Funika mimea ukitumia neti spesheli (kutoka taasisi ya KALRO-Kabete), ili kuzuia uvamizi wa wadudu.
- Nyunyizia kiuwa wadudu kinachoitwa NEEMROC 0.03%EC (Azadirachtin 0.03% w/w /32% neem oil) kwa kiwango cha lita moja kwa ekari moja.

- Zingatia ya kuwa viwavi vipya na vidogo vilivyojitokeza, hufichika kutoka kwa dawa inaponyunyizwa; lakini viwavi vyenye urefu wa milimita 3 hadi 5 huzuiwa na dawa hizo. Unyunyiziaji wa dawa kwenye viwavi vilivyo na urefu wa sentimita moja huwa hauzuii uharabifu wao.
- Tumia nguo maalum za kujikinga, kila wakati unapotumia viuwa wadudu. Fuata maagizo yaliyokwenye pakiti au chupa ya viuwa wadudu, kwa mfano kiwango cha kutumia, mda kabla ya kuvuna, idadi ya wakati mimea inafaa kunyunyiziwa na muda kabla ya kurudi kwenye shamba lilonyunyiziwa. Usimwage viuwa wadudu kwenye mirizabu au michirizi.
- Viuwa wadudu vilivyo orodheshwa kwenye daraja la pili la Shirika la afia duniani vinaweza kutoruhusiwa katika mipangilio ya kuzuia wadudu katika sehemu unayokaa.
- Kila mara fuatilia ushauri wa maafisa wa PCPB juu ya orodha ya hivi karibuni ya viuwa wadudu vilivyosajiliwa (PCPB)

- Tumia Viuwa wadudu kama: LEGACY 5%EC. Lufenuron gramu hamsini kwa lita moja ya maji. Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani: (Ina hatari wastani au kiasi), Mstari wa manjano; Muda wa kuingia shambani baada ya kunyunyiza dawa- wakati dawa inapokauka; Viwango vya dawa vinavyobaki kwenye mimea: Maharage (miligramu 0.02 kwa kilo moja) PHI- Siku tatu; Kabeji (miligramu 0.2 kwa kilo moja) PHI-siku tatu.
- TATA UMEME 2.5 EC. Lambda-Cyhalothrin gramu ishirini na tano kwa lita moja ya maji, au mililita kumi na tano hadi ishirini kwa lita ishirini za maji. Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani: (Ina hatari wastani au kiasi)

Authors.Surname: Miriam Otipa (KALRO), Stephen Kiritai, K.  Kagai and Benson Ngigi (MOALF), Wilson Nabakwe (MOALF), Peninah Munyao (MOALF) and Judith Oyoo (KALRO)

Sections.Value:
- Kuwa na mazoea ya kupangilia nyanya na mimea mingine wasioipenda viwavi aina ya leaf miner, kama vile mahindi, mtama au mwimbi.
- Hifadhi maadui wa kawaida kama vile nyigu na bunzi au mdudu kibibi kwa kupanda nyua za maua kingoni mwa shamba.
- Toa mabaki yote ya mimea, ili kuzua viwavi hawa kuzaliana humo.
- Panda ua la kibaazi au Tephrosia kuzunguka shamba lako ili kuwafukuza viwavi aina ya Leafminer mbali na mimea yako.
- Weka matawi yaliyokauka shinani mwa mimea ili kuzuia pupa wasiingie kwenye mchanga na kuota au kupevuka.

- Tafuta nzi wadogo wenye rangi ya manjano na nyeusi, waaopepea juu ya mimea.
- Tumia mitego yenye rangi ya manjano ili kunasa nzi waliopevuka.
- Chunguza miche iliyo kwenye vitangu na utafute mashimo na alama za mayai yaliotagwa, kabla ya kuipandikiza kwenye shamba.
- Kwenye matawi tafuta alama nyeupe za kutobolewa, kubadili kwa rangi ya manjano na mashimo yaliyosababishwa na nzi wa leafminer wanaotaga mayai kwenye matawi hayo.
- Anza kudhibiti viwavi hivi vya Leafminer mara moja pale unapoona idadi yao imeongezeka na zaidi ya asilimia thelathini ya tawi limeathirika.

- Ng'oa miche iliyoathirika kutoka kwenye vitangu, kwamua matawi yaliyoathirika na uyachome au uzike kwenye shimo lenye urefu wa mita moja.
- Tumia beseni lenye rangi ya manjano na ulijaze nusu na maji au tumia mitego ya manjano ya kunasa ili kuwavutia na kuwaua nzi aina ya Leafminer
- Nyunyizia viuwa wadudu vyenye asili ya miti kama muarubaini (kwa mfano Azadirachtin Neemark EC, Neemaj Super -3000 na Neemroc EC) katika viwango vilivoshauriwa.

- Nyunyizia viuwa wadudu mapema asubuhi au baade jioni ili usiathiri nyuki
- Soma na ufuatilie maagizo kwenye pakiti au chupa.
- Tupa pakiti au chupa za viuwa wadudu kwa njia inayofaa, ili usiathiri samaki na wanyama wengine wa maji.

- Nyunyizia dawa yenye 'abamectin' (mfano Abalone 18EC, Agrimec 18EC, gramu 20 kwa kilo za Amazing top pamoja na gramu themanini kwa kilo za Dynamec) kwa viwango vinavyostahili. Zinauwezo wa kuingia kwenye matawi. Hufanya kazi wakati viwavi wanapoigusa au kuila na kuingia tumboni mwao. IRAC 6. Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani:(Ina hatari wastani au kiasi), PHI siku saba.
- Nyunyiza dawa zenye bifethrin kwa kiwango cha mililita 5 katika lita ishirini za maji. Hufanya kazi wakati viwavi wanapoigusa au kuila na kuingia tumboni mwao; IRAC 3A. Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani:(Ina hatari wastani au kiasi), PHI siku tatu. Kiwango kinachobaki kwenye mimea ni 0.2.
- Lowa mimea na dawa yenye imidaclorid kwa viwango vilivyopendekezwa. Dawa hizi ni za aina ya Neonicotinoid na hufanya kazi kwa kuingia kwenye matawi; wakati viwavi wanapoigusa na wanapoila na kuingia tumboni mwao.IRAC 4A. Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani:(Ina hatari wastani au kiasi)

Leaf miner adult (Central Science Laboratory, Harpenden Archive, British Crown, Bugwood.org)

Authors.Surname: Peter M. Kodwaran, Miriam Otipa (KARI), Irene Mwendandu, Nancy Murage ( MOA), Dora Kilalo (University of Nairobi), Eunice Sakong (MOALF), Samuel Mburu (MOALF) and Miriam Otipa (KALRO).

Sections.Value:
- Pangilia mkunde na mimea ambayo sio aina ya mikunde kama vile mahindi, kabeji na maboga.
- Toa na uchome mabaki yote ya mimea kwenye shamba.
- Panda kunde mapema na utumie aina ya kunde za msimu mfupi kama vile M66, K80. KVU-27.
- Usipande ukiacha nafasi iliyo chini ya sentimita 120 x 30 kati ya mimea.
- Panda mimea ya mseto kama vile mahindi, mwimbi au mtama, ili kuwapa viwavi aina ya podborer mimea mingine wanayoweza kuishi ndani.
- Toa magugu mara kwa mara kwenye shamba lako, kama vile mikunde aina nyingine.

- Tafuta:
• Madoadoa ya rangi ya maji ya kunde kwenye maganda yaliyokomaa ya kunde; mashimo kwenye maua, jicho la ua na pia kwenye maganda.
• Kuanguka kwa maua au maganda ya kunde yaliyo machanga.
• Nondo wa rangi ya maji ya kunde na wenye rangi ya machungwa kufuani. Wako na mista mieupe kwenye pambizo za mabawa yao ya juu.
• Pupa walio na rangi ya maji ya kunde, kwenye matawi, maganda ya kunde na pia mchangani.
• Viwavi vya rangi ya kijani kibichi na vyenye kichwa cha rangi ya maji ya kunde. Pia viko na jozi la madoadoa juu ya kila kijisehemu cha miili yao.
• Ishara za kutanda kwa maua na maganda ya kunde.
• Chukua hatua muafaka wakati mimea asilimia tano inapoathirika.

- Nyunyizia mafuta ya muarubaini, kwa kiwango cha mililita 40 kwa lita 20 za maji.
- Kusanya maganda yote ya mkunde yaliyoathirika na uiharibu kwa kuponda.
- Weka vijiti/ngazi 20 kwa kila ekari ambazo ndege wanaweza kusimamia.

- Tumia nguo maalum za kujikinga, wakati wowote unapotumia viuwa wadudu.
- Fuata maagizo yaliyokwenye pakiti au chupa ya viuwa wadudu, kwa mfano kiwango cha kutumia,wakati wa kunyunyiza, idadi ya wakati mimea inafaa kunyunyiziwa na muda kabla ya kurudi kwenye shamba lilonyunyiziwa. Usimwage viuwa wadudu kwenye mirizabu au michirizi.
- Kila mara fuatilia ushauri wa orodha ya viuwa wadudu vilivyosajiliwa hivi karibuni (PCPB)

- Paka Bacillus thuringiensis kwa mfano Biolep WP, kwa kiwango cha gramu 25 kwa lita 20 za maji. (Sumu ya tumbo; Aina ya Bacteria, IRAC 11). Restrictions:: Daraja la tatu la shirika la afia duniani (Ina hatari kidogo)
- Nyunyizia viuwa wadudu vyenye Deltamethrin kwa mfano Farm-X, Atom 2.5EC na Decis 2.5EC kwa vipimo vya mililita 10-15 kwa lita 20 za maji, rudia baada ya siku saba kama shida inadumu. (Hufanya kazi wakati viwavi wanapoigusa au kuila na kuingia tumboni mwao;aina ya Pyrethroid; IRAC 3A). Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani: (Ina hatari wastani au kiasi); PHI Siku tatu
- Nyunyizia viuwa wadudu vyenye Cypermethrin kwa mfano Debush EC kwa vipimo vya mililita 100 kwa lita 20 za maji, rudia baada ya siku kumi kama shida inadumu. (Hufanya kazi wakati viwavi wanapoigusa au kuila na kuingia tumboni mwao;aina ya Pyrethroid; IRAC 3A). Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani: (Ina hatari wastani au kiasi); PHI Siku tatu

Sections.Value:
- Panda aina ya michele sugu kwa mfano SC213.
- Toa mimea yote iliyoathirika wakati unapong'oa miche kutoka kwa vitangu.
- Tumia mbolea iliyo na madini ya Naitrojeni kwa njia ya kuiweka kwa mgao ili madini hayo yasijae kwenye shamba na kuchangia viwavi kuongezeka.
- Panda mimea yako wakati mmoja na wakulima wengine. Mimea inayopandwa kuchelewa hupata madhara mengi kutokana na wingi wa viwavi kutoka kwenye mimea iliyopandwa mapema.
- Vuna mimea iliyoko karibu na ardhi ili kutoa viwavi vyovyote vilivyo kwenye mabua, halafu gharikisha eneo hilo ili lifurike.
- Haribu mabua yote ya michele baada ya kuvuna, kwa kuwa viwavi hupenda kuishi kwenye mabua hayo.
- Tahadhari na utumizi wa viuwa wadudu vyenye sumu au hatari kubwa, ili kuhifadhi wadudu wenye umuhimu.
- Zingatia wakati ambao hupandi chochote ili kudhibiti viwavi hivi vya Rice stem borer.

- Chunguza mimea yako kila wiki (siku 20 baada ya kupanda kwenye kitangu).
- Tafuta vifungu vya mayai yaliyotagwa, upande wa chini wa matawi.
- Angalia na utafute vichwa-vyeupe wakati wa viwavi kuota au hali ya kukauka kwa kana la katikati wakati viwavi vinakomaa.
- Angalia na utafute viwavi wanaotoboa mashimo shinani mwa mmea na katika mimea iliyokomaa kwenye vipingili vya juu wakiendelea kula wanavyozidi kushuka chini.
- Tafuta mashimo madogo kwenye shina na kana za mimea.
- Chukua hatua za kudhibiti viwavi hawa wakati kuna zaidi ya nondo mmoja au kifungu kimoja cha mayai kwenye eneo la mita moja katika kitangu; au kuna kifungu kimoja cha mayai au nondo mmoja kwenye eneo la mita moja kutoka wakati wa kupanda hadi wa kuota maua; na wakati kuna kifungu kimoja cha mayai na nondo mmoja michele inapokomaa.

- Tumia mikono wakati wa kupandikiza miche kutoka kwa vitangu na pia haribu vifungu vyote vya mayai.
- Toa na uchome mimea yeyote au vichwa vywa michele viliyoathirika sana.
- Ongeza kiwango cha maji yaliyo shambani, ili yafunikie mayai yoyote yaliyomo humo.
- Tumia mitego ya taa kudhibiti viwavi na nondo hawa aina ya stemborer.
- Unaweza pia kutumia aina ya minyoo inayokula na kuua wadudu, na yenye uwezo ya kuwadhibiti

- Udhibiti unahitaji viuwa wadudu vyenye uwezo wa kuingia ndani ya mmea.
- Kama njia zilizoelezewa kwenye sehemu ya 'Kuzuia' zitashindwa, basi tumia viuwa wadudu vilivyo na hatari kidogo.
- Tumia nguo maalum za kujikinga, kila wakati unapotumia viuwa wadudu. Fuata maagizo yaliyokwenye pakiti au chupa ya viuwa wadudu, kwa mfano kiwango cha kutumia, wakati wakuinyunyizia mimea, muda kabla ya kuvuna, idadi ya wakati mimea inafaa kunyunyiziwa na muda kabla ya kurudi kwenye shamba lilonyunyiziwa. Usimwage viuwa wadudu kwenye mirizabu au michirizi.
- Viuwa wadudu vilivyo orodheshwa kwenye daraja la pili la Shirika la afia duniani vinaweza kukosa kuruhusiwa katika mipangilio ya kuzuia wadudu katika sehemu unayokaa.

- Tumia Imidacloprid kunyunyizia (Kwa mfano Confidor 70WG, kipimo cha gramu 5 kwa lita 20 za maji). Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani (Ina hatari wastani au kiasi)
- Tumia Acetamiprid kunyunyizia (Kwa mfano Twiga Ace 20 SI kwa kipimo cha mililita 8 kwa kila lita 20 za maji). Tumia mara moja kwa msimu. Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani: (Ina hatari wastani au kiasi). Ni hatari kwa zamaki na viumbe vya majini. Pia ni hatari kwa maadui wa kawaida wa viwavi vya 'stem borer'.

Authors.Surname: Stephen Kiritai (MoALF), K.  Kagai (MoALF), Miriam Otipa (KALRO) and Benson Ngigi (MoALF), Dora Kilalo (University of Nairobi) Esther macharia  (KALRO), Boniface N. Ndung’u (MoALF)

Sections.Value:
- Weka shamba lako bila magugu wakati mimea inapoendelea kukua, kwa kuwa nzi weupe pia hupenda kuishi kwenye hayo magugu.
- Funikia mimea yako kwa kutumia neti za kuzuia wadudu shambani ili kuwatenga nzi weupe mbali na mimea. (tumia neti zenye matundu madogo sana-400µm).
- Panda mimea inayozuia au kuwafukuza nzi weupe kandokando mwa shamba lako kama vile mgiligilani na bangi ya shambani (Mexican Marigold).
- Ili kuifanya mimea yako iwe na nguvu wakati inapokua, ipande kwenye shamba lililo tayarishwa vyema na lenye rutuba.
- Hifadhi adui wa nzi weupe (kama vile nyigu) kwa kuwacha kunyunyizia kemikali wakati maua yanapochipuka.

- Ili kutambua mapema, tafuta mayai yaliyo meupe au rangi ya maji ya kunde na nzi weupe waliokomaa upande wa chini wa matawi machanga.
- Tafuta wingu la nzi weupe watatu hadi watano wanaotua kwenye matawi baada ya mmea kutikiswa.
- Chunguza ubadilikaji wa rangi ya matawi yaliyo upande wa chini wa mimea na kuwa rangi ya manjano.
- Anza kuweka hatua za kuwadhibiti nzi weupe wakati unapowaona kwenye mimea.

- Weka mitego yenye ute na yenye rangi ya manjano sentimita 50 juu ya ardhi ili kuwanasa nzi waliopevuka. Tumia mitego minne kwa kila eneo la mita 300.
- Nyunyiza viuwa wadudu vyenye 'Azadirachtin 0.03%,wakati unapoona ishara za mimea kuvamiwa na nziweupe, kwa kipimo cha mililita 50 kwa lita 20 za maji.
- Nyunyiza mchanganyiko wa pilipili uliotayarishwa kwa kukatakata pilipili 30, halafu kuloweka kwa maji moto ya lita moja, kwa muda wa siku moja; baadae mchanganyiko huo huwekwa kwenye lita 10 za maji.

- Badilisha viuwa wadudu vyenye dawa aina tofauti tofauti ili kuzuia wadudu kuwa sugu
- Vaa nguo spesheli za kujikinga wakati unapotumia viuwa wadudu.
- Nyunyiza viuwa wadudu asubuhi na mapema au baade jioni ili kuzuia kudhuru nyuki.
- Soma na ufuate maagizo yaliyo kwenye chupa au pakiti.
- Tupa pakiti au chupa za viuwa wadudu kwa njia inayofaa, ili kuzuia kudhuru viumbe vya majini.

- Lowa mimea na viuwa wadudu vyenye 'imidacloprid' kama vile Confidor 200SL, Imax 200SL, na Tata Mida 200SL kwa kipimo cha mililita 10 kwa lita 20 za maji. Dawa hii ni aina iitwayo 'Neonicotinoid, imeorodheshwa kwenye IRAC 4A. Inafanyakazi kwa kuingia kwenye matawi, au wakati inapoguswa au ni sumu inapoliwa na viwavi. Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani (Ina hatari wastani au kiasi), PHI Siku tatu
- Nyunyiza viuwa wadudu vyenye 'lambda-cyhalothrin' kama vile Karate 2.5WG kwa kipimo cha gramu 20 kwa lita 20 za maji na Duduthrin 1.7EC kwa kipimo cha mililita 60 kwa lita 20 za maji. Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani (Ina hatari wastani au kiasi), PHI Siku tatu. Ni hatari kwa samaki na viumbe vingine vya majini.
- Nyunyiza viuwa wadudu vyenye 'alpha-cypermethrin' kama vile Bastox 100EC kwa kipimo cha mililita 6 kwa kila lita 20 za maji na Tata Alpha 10EC kwa kipimo cha mililita 6 kwa kila lita 20 za maji. Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani (Ina hatari wastani au kiasi), PHI Siku tatu

Authors.Surname: Miriam Otipa (KALRO), Paul Kiige (MOALF), Eunice Ringera (KEPHIS), Philip Wendot  (UON) and Benson Masinde  (MOA), Peninah Munyao (MOALF), Judith Oyoo (KALRO), Wilson Nabakwe (MOALF)

Sections.Value:
- Panda miche iliyosafi na haijaathirika na viwavi aina ya Tomato leaf miner.
- Pangilia minyanya na mimea mingine kama vile mahindi, maharagwe na kabeji.
- Chimbua na uchome mimea yote iliyoathirika pamoja na magugu kama mtunguja mwitu.
- Safisha vifaa vyote vinavyotumika kwa usafirishaji wa nyanya kama vile masanduku,matenga na hata malori kwa kutumia sabuni na maji.

- Chunguza na utafute:
• Nondo wenye mchanganyiko wa rangi ya maji ya kunde na ya fedha.
• Mashimo meupe au krimu yaliyoshikana na yanayooza, upande wa juu na chini wa matawi.
• Viwavi vyenye rangi ya kijani kibichi na wenye vichwa vyeusi ndani ya mashimo.
• Utandu wa hariri uliotengenezwa na viwavi, ili kukunja matawi kulinda viwavi wengine wachanga wanaoota.
• Matawi yaliyobadilika rangi au kuoza kwa kuathirika na viwavi.
• Alama za kutobolewa upande wa juu wa matunda, pia kwenye shina la mmea na kovu leusi lililokauka kwenye shimo alilotoka kiwavi.
- Chukua hatua za dharura kudhibiti wakati unapoona kiwavi kimoja hadi vitatu kila wiki.

- Tumia mikono kuvyoga viwavi wkati unapoona ishara za uchimbaji wa mashimo.
- Unaweza kuwanasa kwa wingi kutumia maji yaliyo na kemikali za kuwavutia (kwa mfano Pherodis kwa kiwango cha pakiti 4 kwa ekari, inauzwa na kampuni kama vile Koppert Biological Systems Kenya, na Tutrack ipatikanayo pale Kenya Biologics.
- Zika matawi na matunda yote yaliyoathirika kwenye shimo lenye urefu wa sentimita 50 hadi 100.
- Unaweza pia kutimia mitego nyeusi yenye ute wa kuwanasa, hizi huwekwa sentimita 15 hadi 20 juu ya ardhi ili kuwashika wadudu waliokomaa (tumia vipande 24 kwa kila ekari, inauzwa na kampuni ya Koppert Biological Systems)
- Tumia neti za kuzuia wadudu kwenye paa na kando kando mwa nyumba aina za 'greenhouse', ili kuzuia uhamaji kwa wadudu kutoka eneo moja hadi lingine.

- Tumia nguo maalum za kujikinga, kila wakati unapotumia viuwa wadudu au dawa shambani.
- Fuata maagizo yaliyokwenye pakiti au chupa ya viuwa wadudu, kwa mfano kiwango cha kutumia, wakati wakuinyunyizia mimea, muda kabla ya kuvuna, idadi ya wakati mimea inafaa kunyunyiziwa na muda kabla ya kurudi kwenye shamba lilonyunyiziwa. Usimwage viuwa wadudu kwenye mirizabu au michirizi.
- Viuwa wadudu vilivyo orodheshwa kwenye daraja la pili la Shirika la afia duniani vinaweza kutoruhusiwa katika mipangilio ya kuzuia wadudu katika sehemu unayokaa.
- Kila mara fuatilia ushauri wa orodha ya viuwa wadudu vilivyosajiliwa hivi karibuni (PCPB)

- Tumia: viuwa wadudu vyenye 'Spinetoram'(Kwa mfano Radiant 120 SC, kwa kipimo cha mililita 180 hadi 300 kwa ekari moja au mililita 18 hadi 30 kwa lita 20 za maji). Restrictions:: Daraja la tatu la shirika la afia duniani, Mstari wa rangi ya samawati (Ina hatari wastani au kiasi), PHI Siku tatu.
- Tumia: viuwa wadudu vyenye 'Chlorantraniliprole'(Kwa mfano Coragen 20 SC, kwa kipimo cha mililita 5 kwa lita 20 za maji). Restrictions:: Daraja la U la Shirika la afia duniani, Mstari wa rangi ya kijani kibichi (Ikitumika vizuri haiwezi kuwa na madhara yeyote), kiwango kinachobaki kwenye mimea ni miligramu 0.05 kwa kilo moja ya mimea, PHI Siku tatu.
- Tumia: viuwa wadudu vyenye 'Flubendiamide' (Kwa mfano Belt 480 SC, kwa kipimo cha mililita 4 kwa lita 20 za maji.). Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani, Mstari wa rangi ya manjano, (Ina hatari wastani au kiasi), PHI Siku tatu

Factsheets.Title: Tuta absoluta (tomato leaf miner) on Tomato

Authors.Surname: Stephen Kiritai (MOALF), Miriam Otipa (KALRO), K.  Kagai (MOALF), Benson Ngigi (MOALF), Margaret Mulaa (CABI), Paul Kiige (MOALF)and Judith Oyoo (KALRO)

Sections.Value:
- Tumia karatasi nyeupe au nyeusi za plastiki kama matandazo,siku 10 hadi 20 baada ya kupandikiza miche ili kuwavutia na kuwaua nzi weupe.
- Tumia matandazo ya kawaida (majani yaliyokauka) baada ya kupandikiza mimea itakayokuwa ikinyunyiziwa maji.
- Tumia neti za kuweka kivuli zenye mashimo madogo sana au handaki kwa wiki 3 hadi 5 wakati miche ingali katika vitangu, ili kuzuia nzi weupe kuivamia.
- Hifadhi maadui wa kawaida wa nzi weupe (kwa mfano nyigu,mdudu kibibi) kwa kuweka matandazo au ua la miti yenye maua iliyooteshwa kandokando mwa shamba ili kuwapa makao.(kwa mfano Tithonia, Lantana)
- Pandikiza miche muda mfupi baada ya au wakati wa msimu wa mvua.
- Panda mimea inayozuia au kuwafukuza nzi weupe kama vile mgiligilani na bangi ya shambani (Mexican Marigold) kila baada ya mistari mitatu au minne ya minyanya.
- Panda mimea kwa mfano tumbaku,maharagwe na mahindi, ambayo ina uwezo ya kuwavutia nzi weupe kando kando mwa shamba,ambapo wadudu hawa wanaweza kudhibitiwa na kemikali.
- Weka shamba lako bila magugu wakati mimea inapoendelea kukua, kwa kuwa nzi weupe pia hupenda kuishi kwenye hayo magugu.

- Chunguza na utafute:
• Mayai yaliyo meupe au rangi ya maji ya kunde na nzi weupe waliokomaa upande wa chini wa matawi machanga.
• Wingu la nzi weupe watatu hadi watano wanaotua kwenye matawi baada ya mmea kutikiswa.
• Ubadilikaji wa rangi ya sehemu ya juu ya matawi na kuwa rangi ya manjano.
• Anzisha hatua za kudhibiti wakati nzi weupe watatu wanapopatikana au kuonekana baada ya mmea kutikiswa.

- Tumia mitego yenye ute na yenye rangi ya manjano ili kuwanasa nzi weupe waliopevuka. Tumia mitego minne kwa kila eneo la mita 300.
- Nyunyiza viuwa wadudu vyenye 'Azadirachtin 0.03%,siku kumi na tano baada ya kupandikiza, kwa kipimo cha mililita 50 kwa lita 20 za maji.
- Tumia sabuni ya maji kwa kunyunyiza, tumia kipimo cha vijiko vitatu vya chakula kwa lita moja ya maji.
- Nyunyiza mchanganyiko wa pilipili moto uliotayarishwa kwa kukatakata pilipili 30, halafu kuloweka kwa maji moto ya lita moja,kwa muda wa siku moja; baadae mchanganyiko huo huwekwa kwenye lita 10 za maji, pia ongeza vitone 20 vya sabuni ya maji kabla ya kutumia huu mchanganyiko.
- Nyunyiza maadui wa nzi weupe kwenye minyanya yako, kwa mfano nyigu aina ya Encarsia formosa na pia kutumia kuvu wanaokula wadudu kama vile Beauveria bassiana,na Lecanicillium lecanii

- Vaa nguo za kujikinga kutokana na kemikali na ufuatilie maagizo yaliyo kwenye chupa au pakiti.
- Nyunyiza wakati wa asubuhi na mapema au baadae jioni, ili usidhuru nyuki.
- Tupa pakiti au chupa za viuwa wadudu kwa njia inayofaa, ili kuzuia kudhuru viumbe vya majini.
- Badilisha viuwa wadudu vyenye dawa aina tofauti tofauti ili kuzuia wadudu kuwa sugu

- Lowa mimea na viuwa wadudu vyenye 'imidacloprid' kwa kipimo cha miligramu 5 kwa lita 20 za maji. Dawa hii ni aina iitwayo 'Neonicotinoid, imeorodheshwa kwenye IRAC 4A. Inafanyakazi kwa kuingia kwenye matawi, au wakati inapoguswa au ni sumu inapoliwa na viwavi. Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani (Ina hatari wastani au kiasi), PHI Siku tatu, kiwango kinachobaki kwa mimea ni 0.5.
- Nyunyiza viuwa wadudu vyenye 'lambda-cyhalothrin' kwa kipimo cha mililita 7 kwa lita 20 za maji. Kanuni ya tatu ya IRAC . Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani (Ina hatari wastani au kiasi), PHI Siku tatu, kiwango kinachobaki kwa mimea ni 0.01.
- Nyunyiza viuwa wadudu vyenye 'alpha-cypermethrin' 10EC kwa kipimo cha mililita 5 kwa kila lita 20 za maji. Kanuni ya tatu ya IRAC. Restrictions:: Daraja la pili la shirika la afia duniani (Ina hatari wastani au kiasi), PHI Siku tatu, kiwango kinachobaki kwa mimea ni 0.2.

Whiteflies colonizing leaves (A.M. Varela, icipe)

Sections.Value:
- Use certified seed and seedlings free from disease as this disease can be seed-borne
- Use resistant varieties where available
- Do not plant crucifers in areas: that have a history of the disease; where crucifers have been grown within the previous 2 years; where cruciferous weeds are numerous
- Deep plough fields to bury contaminated crop residues
- Sterlise the seedbed by heaping and slowly burning dry grass or other plant thrash on the seedbed.
- Plant on raised beds for better drainage. Avoid waterlogging.
- Do not damage leaves of seedlings as this makes them prone to disease
- Correct plant spacing: 50 cm between plants and 60 cm between rows. If plants are closer together this can encourage spread of disease between plants
- Avoid flood/furrow irrigation because it will carry the disease from infected to uninfected areas. Also avoid irrigating early in the day when dew is present or late in the day.
- Destroy alternative host weeds in the crucifer family e.g. birdsrape mustard, Indian mustard, black mustard
- Avoid moving through fields when the plant are wet to prevent disease spread. Clean tools and boots.
- Rotate crucifers for a minimum of 3 years with crops that are not susceptible such as maize, legumes, tomato

- Additional relevant crops: cauliflower, chinese cabbage, brussel sprouts, turnip, mustard, broccoli, rape, radish
- Monitor plants weekly for symptoms:
• Look for yellow V-shaped lesions with an open part of 'V' along the edge of the leaf
• The diseased leaf area becomes brown and brittle
• Affected leaf veins turn dark brown to black
• The V-shaped lesions enlarge and the entire leaf evantually turns yellow or wilts and falls from the plant
• Infected seedlings remain stunted and become unproductive
• There is a ring of black discoloured tissue within the stem when cut
- If 6-8 plants/ha show symptoms take action
- The disease thrives in wet conditions with high temperatures

- Remove all infected young plants and debris from the field and destroy by: deep burying; composting well outside the field; feeding crop to livestock
- When older plants become infected, harvest as soon as possible.

Pesticides may be available to control this pest. Please check with the Ministry of Agriculture in your country to find out which pesticides are registered in your country and the local restrictions for their use.

Images.Caption: Symptoms on cabbage (Florence Wakhungu)
Cabbage black rot (Moses Cheruiyot)
Black rot of cabbage (Gathogo GN, Kenya)

Sections.Value:
- Use only thrips-free seedlings from certified nurseries
- Sow early just after the onset of the rains to avoid thrips incidence
- Control weeds in and around the fields or greenhouses to reduce thrips population
- Use UV-reflective mulches to disrupt host location by the thrips
- Mulch with dry grass or polythene to prevent thrips to pupate in the ground
- Conserve natural enemies (predatory thrips, green lacewings, pirate bugs (Orius), parasitic wasps and predatory mites Amblyseius spp.) by avoiding pesticides when natural enemy numbers are high enough to reduce the thrip population
- Plough and harrow the field after harvest to reduce thrips survival
- Keep old fields away from new ones (other vegetables, tobacco and commercial flower plants)
- Avoid planting tomatoes next to onions, garlic, or cereals, because high thrips numbers often build up on these crops
- Avoid using fields near greenhouses where ornamentals (cut flowers) are grown as these plants serve as hosts for the virus and thrips
- Balanced fertilization minimizes preference of thrips for a crop
- Carefully clean equipment with bleach after use in fields or greenhouses

- Monitor regularly for thrips or symptoms from seedlings until harvest by shaking leaves and flowers onto a white piece of paper
- Insect:
• Adult thrips are small and thin insects less than 1 mm with 4 long, narrow fringed wings. Adults are pale yellow to light brown in colour
• Immature stages are yellowish in colour
- Symptoms:
• Feeding by adults and immatures causes silverish spots, distorts plant growth and deforms flowers. They usually feed on the young lower leaf surface, buds, flowers and fruits
• Floral abortion occurs and affected fruits are of poor quality when flower buds are attacked
• Fruits will be marked with tiny dimples caused by adults laying eggs and light brownish flecks caused by feeding larvae
- Take action as soon as you notice one thrip adult on a flower or evidence of any larvae on fruit (look for dimples and flecking on fruit for evidence)
- Initiate control measures when 10% of the plants display symptoms of Tomato spotted wilt virus (see our green list for TSWV)

- Daily overhead irrigation (2-5 mm) at midday to reduce thrips. Leaves must dry quickly to avoid diseases
- Use blue or yellow sticky trap to attract and kill adults (minimum of 8 traps per 0.5 acres)
- Use neem-based products and spray once every two weeks. Spray late afternoon when thrips are active but not too late so that the leaves can dry before night.
- Release natural enemies commercially available in your country such as predatory bugs Orius spp. and predatory mites Amblyseius swirskii or Neoseiulus cucumeris
- Spray Beauveria bassiana at the rate of 10 ml per 20L of water during late afternoon
- Flood the field after harvest to destroy pupae in the soil

Pesticides may be available to control this pest. Please check with the Ministry of Agriculture in your country to find out which pesticides are registered in your country and the local restrictions for their use.

Images.Caption: Frankliniella occidentalis adults (W.D.J. Kirk)
Irregular ripening associated with thrips-transmitted Tomato spotted wilt virus (David Riley, University of Georgia, Bugwood.org)
Oviposition injury to tomato fruit (Whitney Cranshaw, Colorado State University, Bugwood.org)

Sections.Value:
- Remove and destroy (burn) the remenants of previous crop
- If available, use a resistant variety of maize
- Plant early in the season at the onset of rains when leafhopper (MSV vector) populations should be lower
- Avoid planting crop downwind of, or next to, an infested crop
- Maintain a barrier of 10 m of bare ground between maize fields and previously infested crops
- Keep field and neighbouring fields weed free, being particularly careful to remove grassy weeds on which leafhoppers can live
- Apply fertilizer on time, basal dressing at planting and top dressing on knee high maize. Maize will grow fast and be more resistant to infection
- Mix-crop maize with non-grassy/ non-cereal crops like cowpea and pumpkin to reduce leaf / plant hoppers.
- Leave barriers of bare ground or edges of non-grass vegetation between early planted and late planted maize to prevent leafhoppers crossing from late planted to the early planted maize
- Rotate maize with non-cereals such as legumes e.g. soyabeans and beans.
- Avoid the overlap of two maize crops

- Additional relevant crops: oats, barley, wheat, rye, sugarcane, sorghum
- Look out for:
• Leaves: pale spots or flecks, 0.5 mm in diameter. Initial pale (white to yellowish) spots may join together to form longer streaks. These streaks are narrow, more or less broken, running parallel along the leaves
• Leaves: Hopping insects on the underside (leafhoppers). These carry MSV
• Whole plant: Stunted with small cobs if infection happens before the 4-5 leaf stage
• Flowers and shoots: Possible abnormal bunching
- Monitor plants at least weekly from seedling to vegetative stage, particularly when there is high rainfall since this is when leafhopper populations can be high
- Take action as soon as one plant shows disease symptoms
- When there are 3 to 10 leaf hoppers on 100 plants it is likely that the disease will spread if existing in the area. If MSV is not in the area, no action is needed against leafhoppers
- Note the difference between maize lethal necrosis disease (MLND) and MSV. MLDN has thicker yellow stripes along leaves than MSV and can cause necrosis. MSV usually does not lead to necrotic dead leaves
- If yellow-grey angular spots or necrotic grey windows appear on leaves, then this is angular leaf spot disease, not a virus
- Remove infected plants at an early stage - uproot and burn or feed to livestock

Pesticides may be available to control this pest. Please check with the Ministry of Agriculture in your country to find out which pesticides are registered in your country and the local restrictions for their use.

Images.Caption: Plants affected by Mazie streak virus (Eric Haraman)
Streak virus symptoms on maize leaves (PM Kodwaran, Kenya)
Adult leafhopper, a vector of MSV (NBAIR)

Sections.Value:
- It is essential to control bean fly during the first four to five weeks after germination as it causes high economic yield loss in the seedling stage, especially during the dry season:
- Plant early in the season, 3-5 days after the onset of the rains
- Mulch with dry banana leaves, grass, rice straw and other similar plant straw to promote root development and enhance tolerance to maggot damage
- Don't plant leguminous crops next to each other such as common beans, cowpea, soybean, mung bean and peas
- Ridge up the soil around the plants to cover the roots 2-3 weeks after germination to allow roots to grow more quickly
- Encourage natural enemies presence in the fields by planting flower stripes and by not using pesticides
- Remove and destroy volunteer crops
- Frequently irrigate to reduce water stress and strengthen plant to better tolerate the bean flies
- Crop rotation with non leguminous crops
- Avoid overlapping bean crops in the season to reduce build-up

- Additional relevant crops: cowpea, soyabean, pigeon pea, common bean, mungbean, peas
- Look for small black flies of 2 mm on bean leaves from plant emergence up to 2-leaf stage of plants
- Look for tiny yellow feeding and oviposition punctures on the basal portion of the upper side of leaves
- Stem: Search for thickening of the stem at soil level which is made by the the fly larvae feeding inside. Upon cutting the stem open, a brown or dark feeding area of damaged tissue can be seen just underneath the epidermis. This portion will contain larvae and pupae.
• Whole plant: yellowing, wilting, stunting and dying of young plants (2-3 leaf stage)
- Take control measures when 5-10% of the plants are infested

- Uproot and burn withered and dead infested plants to kill the larvae and pupae
- Spray using neem-based products early in the morning or late evening on the plants
- Remove and destroy crop residues as maggots and pupae live in the bean stems.

Pesticides may be available to control this pest. Please check with the Ministry of Agriculture in your country to find out which pesticides are registered in your country and the local restrictions for their use.

Images.Caption: Adult Ophiomyia phaseoli (James Litsinger)
Leaves show feeding and oviposition punctures on the upper side with corresponding light yellow spots (James Litsinger)
When attack is severe, infested leaves become blotchy and later hang down. Leaves may dry out and be shed (James Litsinger)

Sections.Value:
- Bag immature fruits with polythene, paper or silk clothing within one month of flowering
- Harvest fruits at physiological maturity before they become very ripe and soft which makes it easy for the flies to lay eggs in them
- During harvesting, collect infested fruits in black polythene bags, tie them up and expose to sun or bury infested fruits more than 50 cm deep in soil in order to kill larvae and prevent infestation in the next season
- Prune regulary to improve aeration
- Release poultry in the orchard to feed on pupa at the base of plants

- Additional relevant crops: guava, citrus, melons, avocado, pear, mango, banana
- Adult fly: B. dorsalis is about 8 mm long, wings about 7 mm in length, colour is variable - may have yellow and black markings
- Larvae: B. dorsalis is about 10 mm in length, creamy white, forms a dark brown puparium when it matures and emerges from fruit
- Regularly observe fruit trees for adult fruit fly at fruiting stage
- Check for egg-laying holes ('stings') on the surface of the fruits. These holes may be indicated by oozing or dry sap
- Sample fallen fruits and dissect them for fruit fly larvae which are small white maggots
- Set 10 pheromone traps per ha. A catch of 2-3 adult fruit flies per trap per week necessitates control measures (see 'Pheromone traps against fruit flies in citrus' factsheet)

- Apply neem oil or neem seed extract to kill pupating larvae
- Store harvested fruit in cool place or cold storage for 5 days

Pesticides may be available to control this pest. Please check with the Ministry of Agriculture in your country to find out which pesticides are registered in your country and the local restrictions for their use.

Factsheets.Title: Fruit fly on fruit trees
ScientificNames: Bactrocera dorsalis, Bactrocera kandiensis, Bactrocera correcta, Bactrocera tau, Bactrocera zonata

Sections.Value:
- Remove tomato residues and volunteer tomatoes and bury or burn
- Plant varieties which are resistant to whitefly and the viruses it can transmit, if available
- Plant tomatoes 0.5-2 feet apart with at least 3 feet between rows
- Use a shade net (size 400 µm) / tunnel for 3-5 weeks while in nursery to prevent attack by white flies
- Transplant shortly after or during the rainy season
- Use white/black inert plastic mulch 10-20 days after transplanting which attracts and kills white flies
- Conserve natural enemies (wasps, ladybirds) by mulching or leaving a natural hedge of flowering plants (e.g. Tithonia, Lantana) along the edges to offer them refuge
- Plant repellent crops such as coriander or Mexican marigold after 3-4 rows of tomato to repel the whiteflies
- Keep the field weed-free throughout the cropping season since weeds act as alternate hosts and can harbour whitefly-transmitted viruses

- Adult: A sucking insect, about 1 mm long. The body and wings are covered in a powdery, waxy secretion, white to slightly yellowish in colour
- Larva: yellow-white scales, 0.3-0.6 mm long
- Puparium: flat, irregular, oval shape, 0.7 mm long
- After transplanting monitor weekly until harvest
- Search for leaves with whitefly groups (they are mainly on underside of leaves). They will fly when you shake plants.
- Yellowing, curling, crumpling of leaves occurs at heavy infestation.
- Whiteflies can transmit viruses which cause virus disease. Leaves will have yellowish green mosaics
- Action threshold level is 10-20 plants with symptoms and/or at least 20 whiteflies on at least 10-20 plants/acre

- Use yellow sticky traps at about 1 per 5 plants.
- Spray biopesticide Beauveria (check product labels for dosage and application timing). After 21 to 28 days, next application if needed. Another entomopathogenic fungi that white fly is suscptible too is Lecanicillium lecanii
- Use hot pepper spray at rate of 30 chopped peppers in warm water. Soak for 1 day, dilute in 10 L water and add 20 drops of liquid soap before spraying
- Spray Azadirachtin 0.03% (50 ml/20L water) 15 days after transplant
- Use liquid soap spray at rate of 3 table spoons per litre of water
- Conserve natural enemies. Several wasps, including species in the Encarsia and Eretmocerus genera, parasitize whiteflies. Whitefly nymphs are also preyed upon by bigeyed bugs, lacewing larvae, and ladybird larvae.

Pesticides may be available to control this pest. Please check with the Ministry of Agriculture in your country to find out which pesticides are registered in your country and the local restrictions for their use.

Images.Caption: Adults white fly of about 2 mm (Photo by I D. Bedford)
Yellow, leaf curling because of fly (Photo by Wang Dengjie)
A group of white flies under the leaf (Photo by Wang Dengjie)

Sections.Value:
- Keep the nursery and field free of weeds as many weed species are hosts of cutworms
- Plough the field during dry spells, before transplanting, to expose the cutworm to natural enemies and extreme heat
- Remove and burn crop debris before planting to reduce food for cutworms
- Conserve natural enemies such as ground beetles, lacewings, spiders, parasitic wasps, praying mantis, ants, and birds by avoiding the use of chemical pesticides if possible
- Delay transplanting slightly so that stems are as wide as possible (so cutworm cannot completely cut through them)
- If possible, flood the field for a few days before sowing or transplanting as this can help kill cutworm caterpillars in the soil
- Avoid planting host crops before/after or near lettuce field such as okra, leek, groundnut, peppers, melon, cotton. Cutworms attack a wide range of crops.

- Start monitoring for cutworms at seedling stage i.e. soon after germination. As cutworms hide during daytime and are mostly found on plants at night, the best time to look for cutworm is early morning.
- Look out for:
• Dry wilted lettuce, discoloured plants, or cut or fallen seedlings in a small zone
• Larvae - soft bodied, green to dark brown caterpillars at the base of the plant and on the underside of leaves. and
• Whitening or chlorotic lesions on leaves and dried leaves
- Blacklight and pheromone traps can be used to monitor numbers of adults/moths (2 traps/ha)
- Consider direct control when there are more than 5 larvae/10 plants in the farm

- Check and remove egg masses and caterpillars from plants and crush them
- Dig around the damaged plant to get the cutworms and mechanically kill them
- Flood the area to suffocate the larvae in the soil if you are growing lettuce in deep soils
- Mix equal quantities of sawdust, bran and molasses with enough water to make mixture sticky and spread around base of plants to attract and kill caterpillars
- Drench at seedling stage with Azadrachtin 0.03% (e.g. Nimbedicine EC, Nematech WG) at a rate of 35ml/L of water to reduce infestation drastically
- Natural extracts such as lemongrass and ginger can also be applied at 1 L/ 15 L water
- If available in your country, release Trichogramma weekly for 3 consecutive weeks at the first sign of moths to parasitize cutworms eggs.

Pesticides may be available to control this pest. Please check with the Ministry of Agriculture in your country to find out which pesticides are registered in your country and the local restrictions for their use.

Images.Caption: An adult cutworm moth (Whitney Cranshaw, Bugwood.org)
Cutworm caterpillar cutting through a seedling (Francis Nduati, Kenya)
Black cutworm (Agrotis ipsilon) (James Kalisch, University of Nebraska, Bugwood.org)

Sections.Value:
- Use clean cuttings from certified sources. Mealybugs can travel long distances on cuttings.
- Use tolerant varieties if available
- Do not plant near an infested field. Mealybugs spread locally via wind and walking
- To prevent the spread of the insect, avoid rotating or planting near alternative hosts; citrus, avocado, carambola, fig, guava, sugarcane, cassava, mango, asparagus, beans, beets, cabbage, peanuts, pigeon pea, cucumber, lettuce, pepper, pumpkin, tomato

- Look for plant symptoms:
• Stunted growth at growing tips
• In susceptible plants, new growth forms cabbage-like clusters of leaves or may cause crumpling of the leaves
• Distorted leaves and possibly defoliation, bunchy top
• Sooty mold on leaves and stems
- Look for the mealybugs (they can be found on leaves and stems):
• Eggs: tiny, pink
• Crawlers (young): 0.3 mm long, pink/greyish-pink, covered in a white powder
• Adults: 2.5-4 mm long, soft-bodied, elongate oval, slightly flattened. Males have one pair of wings and long antennae.
- Ants 'farm' the honeydew secreted by mealybugs so they may be found on and around the plants
- The pink hibiscus mealybug can look similar to Paracoccus marginatus, but P. marginatus is has a yellow body rather than pink
- Use the mealybug ladybird Cryptolaemus montrouzieri, or parasitoids Anagyrus kamali and Achrysopophagus sp. as biological control if available in your area

Pesticides may be available to control this pest. Please check with the Ministry of Agriculture in your country to find out which pesticides are registered in your country and the local restrictions for their use.

Images.Caption: M. hirsutus (pink hibiscus mealybug); adult females in a field infestation. USA (©Jeffrey W. Lotz/Florida Division of Plant Industry/Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services/Bugwood.org)
M. hirsutus (pink hibiscus mealybug); adult male, in a field infestation. USA (©Florida Division of Plant Industry/Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services/Bugwood.org)

Sections.Value:
- Avoid planting in termite infested fields if possible
- Plough termite mounds prior to sowing to destroy the termite queen and expose the termites to predators (e.g. ants, dragonflies, ground beetles, bats, birds, frogs).
- Plant cuttings at a slightly higher rate to account for losses due to termite damage
- Deep planting of transplants/cuttings
- Remove plant debris around the plant basin/hole before planting since plant debris attracts termites
- Apply wood ashes around the plant in the planting basin/hole to repel termites
- Use optimal irrigation and fertlization rates. Ensure development of strong healthy plants that can tolerate some termite damage.
- Ensure there is plenty of soil humus for termites to feed on instead of crop - avoid bare, dry disturbed, organic-deficient, residue-free soil
- Avoid importing termite infested materials into fields
- Plant cassava cuttings on ridges so they are less likely to be attacked by termites
- Plant cassava cuttings when rains become steady. Termites prefer a dry environment.
- Plant basil (Ocimum spp.) as a barrier to repel termites. Leave space between basil and crop because this native plant may reduce growth/survival of cassava if grown too close.

- Additional relevant crops: maize, yam, rice, sorghum, tomato, peppers, groundnut
- Scout for the presence of termites once a week
- Monitor the field more frequently (twice a week) during dry spells. Most termite damage occurs during dry periods.
- Look for termite nests/mounds in the field and galleries in soil and wood. Termites build nests above and/or below ground depending on the species. Mound structures can vary and be up to 5 m high.
- Adults: ant-like, mostly wingless, 0.5-1 cm long
- The difference between termites and ants is that termites have straight antenna, broad waist, and if wings are present then forewings and hindwings are of the same size and have many veins
- Look for chewed stem cuttings. These grow poorly, die and rot. Termites may even enter the stems, weakening them and causing them to break.
- Consider using direct measures if 5-10 plants are affected in 1 field and if the crop is still far from maturing

- Manually destroy termite nest. Find the queen and destroy it (often deep in the nest). Pour boiling water on the nest or burn plant debris to kill the rest.
- Burn plant residues on top of a termite mound to suffocate them - this is not a long-term control method as the queen will probably not die
- Hand tilling or flooding the termite runways/tunnels will also offer temporary control
- Spray crop with extract of neem leaves or neem fruits and apply wood ashes around the plant. Use 1kg crushed neem leaves and/or fruit in 5L water, and 2 handfuls of ash per plant.
- Spray crop with extract of Lantana camara (Tusepo) leaves. Boil 2 kg crushed leaves in 5L for 30 minutes.
- Use Beauveria bassiana as biological control if available in your country. Bring to boil one teacup of mature seeds for 5 minutes. Allow to cool and then strain to get a clear liquid. Add 1 litre of water.
- Harvest as soon as possible. Termite damage gets worse the closer it gets to harvest.
- Collect and bury/burn plant debris after harvest

Pesticides may be available to control this pest. Please check with the Ministry of Agriculture in your country to find out which pesticides are registered in your country and the local restrictions for their use.

Images.Caption: Termites are mostly wingless ant-like 3-5mm long insects. (Source: R. Hanus)
Large mound in east Africa (G. Keith Douce, University of Georgia, Bugwood.org)

Sections.Value:
- Test for wireworms in soil at least one week before planting by using germinating seed bait (GBS):
• Mix corn and wheat seed - 50:50. Soak mixture in water for 24 hours.
• Place mixture in a hole in the soil, about 10 cm deep, 25 cm wide
• Spread half a cup of the mixture across the bottom of the whole. Wireworms will be attracted to the germinating seed
• Fill the hole in with soil, leaving a soil mound
• Cover the mound with a 50 cm square piece of black plastic. Secure by covering the edges with soil
• Cover the black plastic with a 1 m square sheet of clear plastic and secure by covering edges with soil. This will keep the soil below warm and speed up germination.
• Place a flag or marker next to the mound so it can be located
- Place four GBS traps per hectare, or a minimum of 10 in a field. Examine traps after one week in the soil. If more than one wireworm per trap is found there is a high probability that damage will occur to corn seeds and seedlings. In this instance, plant a less susceptible crop such as a winter cereal instead, or plant maize in an uninfested field if possible.
- Do not grow maize in an infested area for at least two years
- Plant maize when weather conditions are optimal (do not plant early). Otherwise germination may be slow making seedlings more susceptible to wireworm infestation
- Use press wheels at sowing, set at 2-4 kg cm-1 width after planting rain or 4-8 kg per cm in dry soil. Wireworms prefer cultivated soil.
- To prevent the spread of the pest, avoid rotating or planting near alternative hosts. Wireworm attacks most field crops, including oilseeds, grain legumes and cereals. Also canola, potatoes, tomatoes, carrots, coffee, rice, grapes, sunflowers

- Adults: Click beetles, black or dark brown, about 3 mm wide, 10 mm long - dimensions vary with species
- Larvae: The wireworm. Clyclindrical, hardened, shiny generally cream to yellow brown in colour, about 1-2 mm wide, 10-20 mm long - dimensions vary with species
• hollowed out seeds (due to larvae feeding on them)
• Plants turning purple, wilting and breaking at the soil surface (larvae bore into the stalk)
• Ring-barking or complete cutting of stem due to feeding adults. Adults chew on seedlings at or above ground level
• Gaps in stands due to larvae attacking germinating seeds and seedling roots and shoots
- Identify presence of wireworms by hand sieving 10 soil samples (30 x 30 cm) or by using GBS traps (see Prevention)
- Infestations detected after crop emergence cannot be controlled

Pesticides may be available to control this pest. Please check with the Ministry of Agriculture in your country to find out which pesticides are registered in your country and the local restrictions for their use.

Wireworm larva (©dnnya17)

Authors.Surname: Jonathan M. Gekone (MOALF) and Abel Too (KALRO)

Sections.Value:
- Practice crop rotation with maize, wheat, cabbages, onions and beans for one year
- Avoid overhead irrigation which spreads the disease
- Plant certified and clean seedlings
- Avoid alternative hosts such as potato, eggplant, Capsicum, black nightshade and tobacco around the farm and maintain a weed-free crop
- Avoid field operations during wet weather
- For greenhouse tomato, solarize soils by covering with clear polythene in hot weather for at least 4 weeks before planting

- Look out for:
• Drying lower leaves which curl upwards, turn brown, wither but still remain attached to the stems.
• Stems may split open and the pith is often found to be discoloured.
• Lesions with raised brown centres surrounded by distinct white spots with tan or brown centers on fruit (bird's eye spot)
• Progressive wilting of the whole plant
- Take action when one plant is affected.

- Uproot and destroy infected plants by burning or burying at 60-90cm depth
- Disinfect all farm tools by dipping in 10% jik solution (3.85% sodium hypochlorite) at 50ml per litre of water for at least 5 minutes. Prunning knives should be disinfected after pruning every plant.
- Apply a dry mulch to reduce spread of the disease.

- Use protective gear when using a pesticides
- Follow the instructions on the product label and safely dispose empty containers
- Always consult recent list of registered pesticides (PCPB).

- Spray with copper-based fungicides e.g. Copper oxychloride (Amicop 50WP and Cobox 50WP at 60gms/20L of water) and Copper Hydroxide (Cuprocaffaro Micro 37.5 WG and Kocide DFat the rate of 50gms/20L of water) to minimize spread of bacterial infection. Repeat on a 14 day interval. General Restrictions: WHO II (moderately hazardous: toxic to aquatic life and should not be used near waterways or during flowering). PHI: 7 days, REI: 24 hours

Images.Caption: Drying lower leaves which remain attached to the stems. Source: Heinz USA , Bugwood.org
Discoloured stem when cut open. Source: Paul Bachi, University of Kentucky Research and Education Center, Bugwood.org
White spots with tan or brown centers on fruit. Source: Heinz USA , Bugwood.org

Sections.Value:
- Take soil to be tested for calcium deficiency @ KALRO Kabete, Soilcare or KEPHIS
- If soil test results indicate acidity in soil, reduce use of ammonium fertilizers e.g. DAP (diammonium phosphate), urea, ASN (ammonium sulphate nitrate), and instead use neutral and basic fertilizers, e.g. N:P:K, CAN (calcium ammonium nitrate), TSP (triple super phosphate), SSP (single super phosphate) and Mavuno
- Apply lime at least 3 months before planting. Once lime has been applied, use of ammonium fertilizer can begin
- Apply lime once every 4 years @ 2 tonnes/ha (800kg/acre Agricultural Lime CaO 21% Ca). Broadcast and mix with the soil during land preparation
- Available lime material- Agricultural Lime (Koru Lime) CaO - 21% Ca, Dolomite CaMg(CO3)2- 14% Ca, Calcite CaCO3- 40% Ca, Magmax MgCO3- 53% Mg

- Check out symptoms in younger leaves and growing points.
- Look out for death of growing points, leaf distortion, leaf scorching, leaves folding downwards and failure of leaf margins to expand
- Mature leaves are rarely affected
- Check for aborted flowers and dying growing points
- Look for water-soaked discoloration in fruits (blossom end rot) common in tomatoes, Capsicum, peppers and watermelon

- Use foliar feeds below to correct deficiency symtoms on growing crop to improve crop appearance
- Use Calcimax @160ml/160L /acre
- Use calcium nitrate (15.5-0-0 + 26.5 CaO) Foliar Feed at @ 160g/160L/acre

- Always put on protective clothing when applying fertilizers
- Wash protective gear after fertilizer application
- Store protective gear separate from household appliances
- Do not store fertilizer directly on the floor

- Apply lime @ 800kg Agricultural lime (CaO; 21% Ca) per acre. General Restrictions: Apply lime once every 4 years before planting in the field. In greenhouses, apply calcium foliar feed when deficiency symptoms are observed
- Apply top dress fertilizer CAN incase crop has not flowered @ 50kg/acre

Images.Caption: Calcium deficiency in pepper. Source: Penina Munyao, Kajiado County
Calcium deificiency in capsicum. Source: Paul Bachi, University of Kentucky Research and Education Center, Bugwood.org
Calcium deficiency in watermelon. Source: Gerald Holmes, California Polytechnic State University at San Luis Obispo, Bugwood.org

Authors.Surname: Esther Macharia (KALRO), Berrick Ochieng (UoN), B. Mbevi (KALRO)

Sections.Value:
- Do not throw dodder plant parts onto other vegetation
- Practise crop rotation with a 3-4 year cycle of unsusceptible crops such as wheat, maize, sorghum, millet, grasses, napier and lilies
- Collect dodder plant fragments thrown on other vegetation and destroy them by burying 60cm deep
- Plant fruit tree seeds that are not contaminated with dodder seeds
- Wash pruning equipment with water before moving from infested to clean areas. Dispose of the water into a pit 60cm deep
- Keep fields free of weeds such as lucerne and alfalfa, that may serve as alternative hosts

- Look out for:
• Root-like sucker arising from tendrials and penetrates the host
• A dense mat of stems that entangle the host
• White or greenish, flowers aggregated in groups of 3-8
• A light-brown boll containing 2-4 light-brown or brownish oval seeds
• Leafless, smooth, yellow or orange twining stems and tendrils, with inconspicuous scales
- Control dodder weed infestations 10 days after emergence before they attach to the host
- Additional relevant crops: coffee, ornamental trees, groundnuts, black nightshade

- Remove dodder infestation by hand before seed set then destroy by composting
- If only a few branches are affected, prune infected portion of the host plant 1/8 to 1/4 inch below the point of attachment
- Weed out dodder before it attaches to a host plant
- Reduce dodder infestations by mowing the alternate host plant just below the point of dodder attachment (about 1/8 to 1/4 inch) for the method to be effective

- When using a pesticide, always wear protective clothing. Do not empty into drains.
- Follow the instructions on the product label
- Always consult recent list of registered pesticides (PCPB)

- Spray 2,4-D Amine 720g/L salt equivalent to 600g/L acid such as (Murphamine 72% SL) and Meamine 2,4-D @ 800ml/Ha and repeat after 30 days. General Restrictions: WHO Class II, moderately hazardous (yellow band). Use to control dodder seedlings at 10 days after germination before they attach to host
- Do spot treatment application of Roundup (glyphosate 360g/L as glyphosphate acid or 480g/L as IPA salt on young weed seedlings. . General Restrictions: WHO Class U, unlikely to present acute hazard under normal use (green band). REI: 4 hours, MRL and PHI are not applicable in non-cropped areas: Repeat if dodder seedlings re-emerge
- Spray young dodder with Paraquat dichloride 27.6% as Parapaz 200SL at 3L/Ha. General Restrictions: WHO Class II, moderately hazardous (yellow band). PHI: 48-90 days. MRL and PHI are not applicable in non-cropped areas.

Images.Caption: Field dodder with leafless, smooth, yellow or orange twining stems and tendrils. Source: John D. Byrd, Mississippi State University, Bugwood.org
Field dodder with leafless, smooth, yellow or orange twining stems and tendrils on mango tree. Source: Samson Kiboi (MoA, Tranzoia)
Field dodder with leafless, smooth, yellow or orange twining stems and tendrils on coffee tree. Source: Wekesa Lucas (MoA, Bungoma)

Sections.Value:
- Take soil to KALRO Kabete, KEPHIS or Soilcare for iron deficiency evaluation
- If the soil test report indicates soil alkalinity, use acidifying ammonium fertilizers e.g. ammonium sulphate or urea and Iron-containing fertilizers such as iron sulphate @ 6kg/acre in two split applications
- Apply organic manures e.g. FYM (farmyard manure) and disease-free crop residues to improve iron uptake. Broadcast organic manure and mix with the soil during land preparation
- At planting, place 2 handfuls of well-decomposed FYM in each planting hole

- Check out symptoms in young emerging leaves
- Check for light green chlorosis of all tissues between veins
- Look for green viens between chlorotic areas
- Older leaves are rarely affetced
- In small grains, check for yellow stripes between veins

- Apply the following foliar sprays on growing plants to improve crop appearance: Farmphoska FE 13EDTA @ 6ml/ 20litres/acre or iron sulphate chelate @ 3% solution. For kitchen gardens, dissolve 0.5 ml in 5 litres of water and spray on plant leaves.
- Apply 2 handfuls of well decomposed FYM in each planting hole

- Always wear protective gear when applying fertilizer and dissolving the foliar feed
- Wash protective gear after application of fertilizer and foliar feed
- Do not use fertilizer and foliar application apparatus for domestic use
- Dispose of foliar holding containers safely
- Keep foliar feed out of reach of children

- Apply ferrous iron sulphate @ 6 kg iron sulphate /acre in split application . General Restrictions: Excessive liming and high application of phosphatic fertilizer e.g. DAP (diammonium phosphate), NPK SSP (single superphosphate) can induce iron deficiency. Follow soil test report recommendation on amounts of fertilizer to apply.

Images.Caption: Rice leaves showing iron deficiency. Source: Dr Prakash Kumar
Iron deficiency in rice. Source: IRRI
Rice leaves showing the later stages of iron deficiency. Source: Dr Prakash Kumar

Sections.Value:
- Destroy crop debris at the end of the cropping season to prevent pest build-up
- Keep field free of weeds that may serve as alternate hosts
- Check transplants for mines before planting and destroy those infested by burning/burying
- Encourage natural enemies e.g. Diglyphus spp., by providing hedgerows of flowering plants
- Mulch the ground around the plant with dry leafy plant material to prevent pupae getting to the soil for further development

- Look for meandering whitish tunnels on the leaf surface
- Closely examine the tender young leaf to see the larvae feeding inside these tunnels
- Look for black faecal materials within the tunnels on young leaves
- Look for deformed, stippled and curled leaves that remain green
- Look out for premature leaf drop in young plants in heavy infestation
- Look out for small black and yellow adult flies on the underside of the leaf in the morning and evenings
- Place plastic trays about 30cm by 37.5 cm in size beneath the plant at randomly selected places in the field and treat when 10 pupae per day are seen for 3 to 4 days

- Hang pheromone traps on the plant at shoulder height to attract and trap male moths
- Remove all infested leaves and destroy by burning or burying at 60 cm depth
- Keep plants well watered to keep them healthy and vigourous
- Remove water sprouts that might act as sites for moths to lay eggs
- Spray azadirachtin 0.15%, e.g. Achook 0.15 EC @ 30ml/20l or Neemroc EC @20-50ml/20L
- Apply Petroleum oils (DC TRON PLUS @ 50ml/20l, PHI 1 Day)

- When using a pesticide, always wear protective clothing. Do not empty into drains.
- Follow the instructions on the product label, such as dosage, timing of application, max. number of sprays, restricted re-entry interval
- Always consult recent list of registered pesticides (PCPB)
- Chemical control should target the larvae. Spray when larvae are actively feeding on the leaf tunnels

- Apply thiocyclam 50% w/w of thiocyclam-hydrogenoxalate, e.g. Evisect S at 10ml/20L water or Taurus @10g/20L of water. General Restrictions: WHO class II (moderately hazardous) PHI 5 Days. Max 3 applications per season. Re-entry interval-12hrs.
- Spray Spinosad-based insecticides like Tracer 480SL, at 4mls/20L water. General Restrictions: WHO class III (slightly hazardous). PHI 7 days MRL 0.7mg/kg Spinosyn; IRAC 5. Active by contact and ingestion
- Spray cyromazine 75% w/w based insecticides like (Trigard 75WP) @60g/20l of water . General Restrictions: WHO Class III, slightly hazardous. PHI 3 days.
- Spray bifenthrin e.g. Brigade EC at a rate of 20ml in 20 litres of water. . General Restrictions: WHO class II (moderately hazardous). PHI 3 days. MRL 1.0mg/kg. Non-systemic with contact stomach action. Pyrethroid; IRAC 3A

Images.Caption: Young tree tomato leaf with serpentine mines. Source: NBAIR
small black and yellow adult  leafminer fly. Source:  Lyle J. Buss, University of Florida

Sections.Value:
- Take soil for Molybdenum deficiency evaluation to KALRO, KEPHIS or Soilcare
- If soil test results indicate soil acidity, reduce use of ammonium fertilizers e.g. DAP (diammonium phosphate) and ammonium sulphate but use neutral and basic fertilizers e.g. N:P:K,CAN (calcium ammonium nitrate)
- Apply dolomitic lime @ 2-8 tonnes/ha (800kg to 3200kg/acre) depending on the deficiency level indicated in soil test report
- Apply Molybdenum fertilizer e.g. ammonium molbdate 54% Mo, sodium molybate 39% or Molybdenum trioxide 66%Mo @ 400g/acre

- Check out symptoms in older leaves especially in vegetables and legumes, such as cabbages, cauliflower, tomato, lettuce, sunflower, lucern, napier and broccoli
- Look out chlorosis between veins and along edges
- Check out symptoms in older leaves especially in vegetables and legumes
- Look for burning edges of leaves due to accumulation of unused nitrates

- Lime application (rate to be determined by the soil test report) to be applied at least 6 months before planting
- Apply organic manure @ 4-5 handful of FYM (farmyard manure) in each planting hole. Broadcast large amounts in the field and mix with the soil during land preparation.

- Always wear protective clothing when handling and applying fertilizers
- Wash protective clothing after application of fertilizer
- Separate fertilizer application apparatus from home appliances
- Molybdenum can be mixed with fertilzers in solid or in solution then applied to seedlings in seed bed 2 weeks before transplanting, on leaves in growing plants or in soil at the base of plants.

- Apply dolomitic lime @ 2-8 tonnes/ha (800kg to 3200kg/acre) depending on the deficiency
- Fodder: Apply Molybdenum trioxide orammonium molybdate or sodium molybdate @30g /acre mixed with fertilizer
- Vegetables: Dissolve 400g/50 litre of water ammonium molybdate or sodium molybdate and apply in seed bed 2 weeks before transplanting. In growing crops in the field, dissolve 50g/100litres of water of ammonium molybdate or sodium molybdate and spray on leaves or at the base of plant.
